SENT.plain: Three generations of a kindred had a history and physical findings consistent with congenital contractural arachnodactyly (CCA) segregating in an autosomal-dominant manner
Six of the seven affected patients we examined had mitral valve prolapse (MVP) diagnosed clinically or by echocardiography
The family members without CCA did not have MVP
This association of cardiac involvement with CCA further lessens the distinction between CCA and the Marfan syndrome
The indication for ophthamologic and echocardiographic follow-up of patients carrying the diagnosis of CCA is stressed
